result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle M. Lasiewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court went on record w/o Clerk.  Per Judge, State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Jim Sempf.  Atty David Westrick apprs.  Discussion held.  Leave on for trial.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with BAL 1/14/43 or their residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

ADDRESS INFO for Michelle M. Lasiewicz
Current: 216 W Center St, c/o DCJ, Juneau, WI 53039 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2015)
Prior: W9800 County Road G Lot 11, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

Defendant Michelle M. Lasiewicz in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn Schmidt (will appoint).  Kevin Schmidt by James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with BAL 1/14/43 or her residence.    Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.Return date scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.
